authors.name: Andrea R Daniel
authors.note: This protocol was adapted from the work of Sean McCutcheon and colleagues in the Gersbach lab at Duke University.

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"48n05","text":"This protocol describes methods for a Perturb-seq assay characterizing transcriptional regulators of T cell function. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Perturb-seq, CRISPRi, CRISPRa, T cells, scRNA-seq
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"k3ed","text":"McCutcheon, S.R., Swartz, A.M., Brown, M.C. et al. Transcriptional and epigenetic regulators of human CD8+ T cell function identified through orthogonal CRISPR screens.Nat Genet (2023). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":168,"length":9},{"style":"sup","offset":105,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fc731","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"1sbhp","text":"Addgene: pLV hU6-gRNA hUbC-dSaCas9-KRAB-T2A-Thy1.1 (Addgene 194278) and pLV hU6-gRNA hUbC-VP64-dSaCas9-VP64-T2A-Thy1.1 (Addgene 194279).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Biotechnol. 36, 411–420 (2018).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":168,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":185,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"986n6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mbu1","text":"70. McGinnis, C. S., Murrow, L. M. \u0026 Gartner, Z. J. DoubletFinder-doublet detection in single-cell RNA sequencing data using artificial nearest neighbors. Cell Syst. 8, 329–337 (2019).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":155,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":166,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jt8d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88gbd","text":"71. Kuleshov, M. V. et al. Enrichr—a comprehensive gene set enrichment analysis web server 2016 update. Nucleic Acids Res. 44, 90–97 (2016).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":104,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":123,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"asqv2","text":"Oligonucleotide pools containing 40-gRNA sequences and constant regions for polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification were synthesized by Twist Bioscience. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39ng9","text":"gRNA amplicons were gel extracted, PCR purified and input into 20 μl Gibson reactions (5:1 molar ratio of insert to backbone) with 200 ng of Esp3I digested and 1 × solid-phase reversible immobilization (SPRI)-selected (Beckman Coulter) plasmid backbone. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kr76","text":"Gibson reactions were purified using ethanol precipitation and transformed into Lucigen’s Endura ElectroCompetent Cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"331cp","text":"Transformed cells were cultured overnight and plasmids were isolated using Qiagen Midi Kits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"df9qo","text":"Plate 1.2 x 106 or 7 x 106 HEK293T cells in a 6 well plate or 10 cm dish in the afternoon with 2 mL or 12 mL of complete opti-MEM (Opti-MEM‱ I Reduced Serum Medium supplemented with 1x  Glutamax, 5% FBS, 1 mM Sodium Pyruvate, and 1x MEM Non-Essential Amino Acids).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3j0aj","text":"Addgene: pLV hU6-gRNA hUbC-dSaCas9-KRAB-T2A-Thy1.1 (Addgene 194278) and pLV hU6-gRNA hUbC-VP64-dSaCas9-VP64-T2A-Thy1.1 (Addgene 194279).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52hmi","text":"The next morning, transfect HEK293T cells with 0.5 μg pMD2.G, 1.5 μg psPAX2, and 0.5 μg transgene for 6 well plates or 3.25 μg pMD2.G, 9.75 μg psPAX2, and 4.3 μg transgene for 10 cm dishes using Lipofectamine 3000.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d02bv","text":"Exchanged media 6 hours after transfection and collect and pool lentiviral supernatant at 24 hours and 48 hours after transfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8opim","text":"Centrifuged lentiviral supernatant at 600g for 10 min to remove cellular debris. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3m2vt","text":"Concentrate lentivirus to 50–100× the initial concentration using Lenti-X Concentrator (Takara Bio). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"an785","text":"Transduce T cells at 5–10% v/v of concentrated lentivirus at 24 h post-activation. For dual transduction experiments, T cells were serially transduced at 24 h and 48 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ls5v","text":"CD8+CCR7+ T cells from three donors were transduced with CRISPRi and CRISPRa mini-TF gRNA libraries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":3,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":8,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hgml","text":"T cells were expanded for 10 days and then stained and sorted for Thy1.1+ cells (a marker to identify transduced cells). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":72,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42nai","text":"Sorted cells were loaded into the Chromium X for a targeted recovery of 2 × 104 cells per donor and treatment according to the Single Cell 5′-High-Throughput Reagent Kit v2 protocol (10x Genomics). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":78,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mrvk","text":"An SH800 FACS Cell Sorter (Sony Biotechnology) was used for cell sorting and analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e05kv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnp6p","text":"Antibody: Thy1.1-PE, clone OX-7, Mouse IgG1, κ, 1:300, Flow cytometry,\tStemCell Technologies,\t60024PE\t","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9kqaa","text":"For antibody staining of Thy1.1 cells were collected, spun down at 300g for 5 min, resuspended in flow buffer (1× phosphate-buffered saline (PBS), 2 mM ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid and 0.5% bovine serum albumin) with the appropriate antibody dilutions and incubated for 30 min at 4 °C on a rocker. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2dldl","text":"Cells were then washed with flow buffer, spun down at 300g for 5 min and resuspended in flow buffer for cell sorting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6t06h","text":"SaCas9 gRNA sequences were captured by spiking in 2 μM of a custom primer into the reverse transcription master mix, as previously done for SpCas9 gRNA capture36. The custom primer was designed to bind to the constant region of SaCas9’s gRNA scaffold.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":159,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":159,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5FA932FA954311EE9FE80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR36"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3o94","text":"5′-Gene Expression (GEX) and gRNA libraries were separated using double-sided SPRI bead selection in the initial cDNA clean-up step. 5′-GEX libraries were constructed according to manufacturer’s protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"47rbs","text":"gRNA libraries were constructed using two sequential PCRs (PCR 1: 10 cycles, PCR 2: 25 cycles). The PCR 1 product was purified using double-sided SPRI bead selection at 0.6 × and 2 ×. Twenty percent of the purified PCR 1 product was input into PCR 2. The PCR2 product was purified using double-sided SPRI bead selection at 0.6 × and 1 ×. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ujf2","text":"All libraries were run on a High Sensitivity D1000 tape to measure the average amplicon size and quantified using Qubit’s dsDNA High Sensitivity assay. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1e8ou","text":" Libraries were individually diluted to 20 nM, pooled together at desired ratios and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq S4 Full Flow Cell (200 cycles) with the following read allocation: Read 1, 26; i7 index, 10; Read 2, 90. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c79h","text":"All oligos are available in Supplementary Table 5 of McCutcheon et al. Nature Genetics, 2023. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7l9dt","text":"CellRanger v6.0.1 was used to process, demultiplex and generate UMI counts for each transcript and gRNA per cell barcode. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39opg","text":"UMI counts tables were extracted and used for subsequent analyses in R using the Seurat69 v4.1.0 package.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":87,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":87,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0144BEE3954411EE9FE80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR69"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9llnn","text":"Low-quality cells with \u003c200 detected genes, \u003e20% mitochondrial reads or \u003c5% ribosomal reads were discarded.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fd6ig","text":"DoubletFinder70 was used to identify and remove predicted doublets. All remaining high-quality cells across donors for each treatment (CRISPRi or CRISPRa) were aggregated for further analyses. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":13,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"21F119F5954411EE9FE80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR70"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jnco","text":"gRNAs were assigned to cells if they met the threshold (gRNA UMI \u003e4). Cells were then grouped on the basis of gRNA identity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b09k6","text":"For differential gene expression analysis, we compared the transcriptomic profiles of cells sharing a gRNA to cells with only NT gRNAs using Seurat’s FindMarkers function to test for DEGs with the hurdle model implemented in model-based analysis of single-cell transcriptomics (MAST).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0qb4","text":"All significant gRNA–gene links are available in Supplementary Table 3 of McCutcheon et al. Nature Genetics, 2023. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdcr3","text":"Upregulated DEGs were input into EnrichR’s GO Biological Process 2021 database71 for functional annotation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":78,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6985F207954411EE9FE80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR71"}}}}

title: Perturb-seq characterizing regulators of T cell function
